alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 1:36AM CDT until September 02 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 133 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy showers moving repeatedly over the same locations. This is especially true in urban areas around Foley and along Highway 59, where some minor flooding will likely develop shortly. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and this area will be monitored closely for a flash flood warning if heavy rainfall continues to persist over these locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Foley, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour and Marlow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
